title: Immunity-boosting spices to beat flu symptoms | The Times of India
description: Our immune system helps protect us against bacteria and several viruses. It keep illnesses and infections at bay, which is why taking care of it should be our top most priority. Spices can be the best home remedies to start with.
cleaned_text: immune system Our immune system is made up of a complex network of cells, tissues, organs, and the substances, which help combat infections and other diseases. Unfortunately, a change in weather, air pollution and the rise in flu cases are all putting a strain on our immune system. Frequent illnesses, higher stress levels, slow-healing wounds, recurrent cold symptoms are all signs of a weakened immune system. While medicines have a big role to play in our recovery process, home remedies are the best and the most natural way to ease our pain. Having said that, here are some immunity-boosting spices to boost your immunity. [Also read: Watermelon season is here! Benefits of chomping on this refreshing fruit](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/life-style/health-fitness/diet/watermelon-season-is-here-benefits-of-chomping-on-this-refreshing-fruit/photostory/98367388.cms) [readmore](javascript://) 02/6Cumin seeds Cumin is a spice obtained from a plant called the Cuminum cyminum. Cumin seeds are great sources of antioxidants that help eliminate tiny free radicals, which attack healthy cells. Furthermore, it is also rich in iron, calcium and magnesium, which help in maintaining overall health. Not only does it add a lot of flavour to the foods and drinks, it also helps boost immunity, as it contains high anti-bacterial and anti-inflammatory properties. [Also read: B12](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/life-style/health-fitness/diet/b12-deficiency-vegetarian-foods-rich-in-vitamin-b12/photostory/98584509.cms) [readmore](javascript://) 03/6Turmeric Turmeric is one of the most common spices you'll find in every Indian kitchen. Besides adding flavour and colour to the food, it is also known to boost immunity and reduce inflammation in the body. Curcumin is a major component of turmeric, which is said to possess antiviral properties that help in fighting infections and illnesses. It is also rich in antioxidants, anti-fungal, antimicrobial and antibacterial properties, which help keep infections at bay. [readmore](javascript://) 04/6Ajwain Carom seeds or ajwain is another common spice that helps add flavour to foods. It is said to have anti-inflammatory properties, which help reduce inflammation in the body and boost immunity. It is easy to consume and is also known to ease digestive issues and gastric problems. [readmore](javascript://) 05/6Clove Clove, also known as laung, is an excellent source of antioxidants that help support the immune system. It is also rich in Vitamin E, Vitamin C, Folate, Riboflavin, Vitamin A, Thiamine, Vitamin D, Omega 3 fatty acids and contain anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial properties, which are all key to maintaining overall health and immunity. [readmore](javascript://) 06/6Black pepper Black pepper can aid the immune system tremendously. According to WebMD, its active compounds play a significant role in boosting white blood cells, which your body uses to fight off bacteria and viruses, hence avoiding infections.
